query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Mentre che sì per l’orlo, uno innanzi altro, 2 ce n’andavamo, e spesso il buon maestro 3 diceami: «Guarda: giovi ch’io ti scaltro»;
query.error: **English:** 1 While thus along the bank, one before the other, 2 we went our way, and often the good master 3 said to me: "Look: it is good that I make you wise";

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 feriami il sole in su l’omero destro, 5 che già, raggiando, tutto l’occidente 6 mutava in bianco aspetto di cilestro;
query.error: **English:** 4 the sun was striking me on my right shoulder, 5 which, already shining, was changing all the west 6 from a white appearance to a light blue;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 e io facea con l’ombra più rovente 8 parer la fiamma; e pur a tanto indizio 9 vidi molt’ ombre, andando, poner mente.
query.error: **English:** 7 and I, with my shadow, made the flame 8 appear more glowing; and yet by this sign 9 I saw many shades, walking, take note.
query.result: 7 ha vy, gans ow fluj, a wrug an tanow 8 dhe weles moy tewl; ha dre henna merk 9 yth weles moy lies, ow mos, ow kemerke.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Questa fu la cagion che diede inizio 11 loro a parlar di me; e cominciarsi 12 a dir: «Colui non par corpo fittizio»;
query.error: **English:** 10 This was the reason that gave them cause 11 to speak of me; and they began 12 to say: "That one does not seem a fictitious body";

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 poi verso me, quanto potëan farsi, 14 certi si fero, sempre con riguardo 15 di non uscir dove non fosser arsi.
query.error: **English:** 13 then towards me, as much as they could, 14 some drew near, always taking care 15 not to come out where they would not be burned.
query.result: 13 wosa dhe'm, kyns o kellas a alleth, 14 nebes omma, bythkweth haval orth 15 dhe'n mos dhe'n dalleth le mayth losow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 «O tu che vai, non per esser più tardo, 17 ma forse reverente, a li altri dopo, 18 rispondi a me che ’n sete e ’n foco ardo.
query.error: **English:** 16 "O you who go, not to be slower, 17 but perhaps out of reverence, behind the others, 18 answer me who burn in thirst and fire.
query.result: 16 "O thus ow mos, nag dhe bos moy tardeth, 17 mes efalla rak reverens, wosa dhe erel, 18 lever dhe'm ow th'y'n syth ha tanow losow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Né solo a me la tua risposta è uopo; 20 ché tutti questi n’hanno maggior sete 21 che d’acqua fredda Indo o Etïopo.
query.error: **English:** 19 Nor is your answer needed by me alone; 20 for all these have a greater thirst for it 21 than Indians or Ethiopians have for cold water.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Dinne com’ è che fai di te parete 23 al sol, pur come tu non fossi ancora 24 di morte intrato dentro da la rete».
query.error: **English:** 22 Tell us how it is that you make yourself a wall 23 against the sun, just as if you had not yet 24 entered the net of death.
query.result: 22 Lever dhe'n pyth owth wra dhe'th parth a'n howl, 23 pur lemmyn thus na veu eth mos dhe'n bys 24 dhe'n ros a verwel dhe'n ros a verwel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Sì mi parlava un d’essi; e io mi fora 26 già manifesto, s’io non fossi atteso 27 ad altra novità ch’apparve allora;
query.error: **English:** 25 Thus one of them spoke to me; and I would have 26 already revealed myself, if I had not been 27 attentive to another new thing that appeared then;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 ché per lo mezzo del cammino acceso 29 venne gente col viso incontro a questa, 30 la qual mi fece a rimirar sospeso.
query.error: **English:** 28 for through the middle of the burning path 29 came people with their faces towards this one, 30 who made me pause to look at them.
query.result: 28 rag dre gres an fordh losow 29 dheuth tus a-ji dhe'n fordh henna, 30 hag a wrug dhym dhe selwel dhe'n re.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Lì veggio d’ogne parte farsi presta 32 ciascun’ ombra e basciarsi una con una 33 sanza restar, contente a brieve festa;
query.error: **English:** 31 There I see on every side each shade 32 make haste and kiss one another 33 without stopping, content with a brief greeting;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 così per entro loro schiera bruna 35 s’ammusa l’una con l’altra formica, 36 forse a spïar lor via e lor fortuna.
query.error: **English:** 34 thus within their dark troop 35 one ant noses another, 36 perhaps to ask about their path and their fortune.
query.result: 34 henna hemma dre'n skwir brun 35 unn moryonen ow posya unn aral, 36 efalla dhe gosya'n fordh ha'n forton.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.result: 37 Kyns ages henna ow parti an koslow ker, 38 kyns ages an kynsa pas dhe'n fordh ena, 39 pub unn ow strif dhe leverel:

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 e raccostansi a me, come davanti, 50 essi medesmi che m’avean pregato, 51 attenti ad ascoltar ne’ lor sembianti.

55 non son rimase acerbe né mature 56 le membra mie di là, ma son qui meco 57 col sangue suo e con le sue giunture.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

88 Or sai nostri atti e di che fummo rei: 89 se forse a nome vuo’ saper chi semo, 90 tempo non è di dire, e non saprei.

query.result: 88 Wosa, tusa a wydh aga oberow ha pyw o syns culpabyl: 89 agy mar karas dhe dhyski pyw ywni, 90 nyns yw termyn rag leverel, ha na'm gwyskons.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.result: 94 Avel yn tristidhes Lycurgus 95 dew vab a wra gwyls ow tosow dhe weles aga mamm, 96 henna yw ow gwres, mes na'm wra'n ow sevel dhe henna lefel,

query.result: 103 Wosa ow bos sodhek a-dhyworth tosow dhe'n, 104 owth offrya dhe'n ow honan yn parys dhe'y servya 105 gans an gonfirm owth gwri erel dhe gresi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.result: 106 Ha henna dhe'm: "Tusa a wra gavas henna merk, 107 rag an peth ow klevys, ynno, ha henna kler, 108 na yll Lethe aga kemer po gwres aga dowr."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Ma se le tue parole or ver giuraro, 110 dimmi che è cagion per che dimostri 111 nel dire e nel guardar d’avermi caro».

query.result: 109 Mes mar plyw orthow a-le a-waryas, 110 dywgh mar a-ugh an aghen a-dhiskwedh 111 y'th leverel ha'th selwel bos mar gerens."

query.prompt:

112 E io a lui: «Li dolci detti vostri, 113 che, quanto durerà l’uso moderno, 114 faranno cari ancora i loro incostri».
query.error: **English:** 112 And I to him: "Your sweet words, 113 which, as long as modern usage shall endure, 114 will make their inks precious still."
query.result: 112 Ha my a-dho: "An gerensow melyon, 113 a-berth bys vyth an arverus a-barth, 114 a wra aga ynk yn gerens aga lyther."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 «O frate», disse, «questi ch’io ti cerno 116 col dito», e additò un spirto innanzi, 117 «fu miglior fabbro del parlar materno.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Versi d’amore e prose di romanzi 119 soverchiò tutti; e lascia dir li stolti 120 che quel di Lemosì credon ch’avanzi.
query.error: **English:** 118 He surpassed all others in love verses and prose romances; 119 and let the fools say what they will, 120 who believe that the one from Limoges surpasses him.
query.result: 118 Gwersow karanteth ha lytherow romansow 119 a-ugh ef an gwella oll; ha gans an folys 120 a grys Lemojez a-grys ef a-ugh gwella.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 A voce più ch’al ver drizzan li volti, 122 e così ferman sua oppinïone 123 prima ch’arte o ragion per lor s’ascolti.
query.error: **English:** 121 They turn their faces more to clamor than to truth, 122 and thus they form their opinions 123 before art or reason is heard by them.
query.result: 121 Aga levow moy es dhe'n gwirra a-dro dhe'n fasow, 122 ha gwellhe'n aga brederow yn aga menow 123 kyns es kons ha reson a-ugh klevys gansow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.result: 124 Gwellhe'n moy a-ugh lies an koth a-rag Guittone, 125 a-ro's aga molla moy a-ro's aga molla, 126 bys es gwirra gans moy tus a-ugh ef a-ugh gorrys.

133 Poi, forse per dar luogo altrui secondo 134 che presso avea, disparve per lo foco, 135 come per l’acqua il pesce andando al fondo.

query.result: 136 Yv a-ugh gwreys dhe'n onan a-ugh diskwedhys dhym kyns, 137 ha leveris es dhe'n hanow ef a-ugh parya orth yv 138 le mayth plas grasus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 El cominciò liberamente a dire: 140 «Tan m’abellis vostre cortes deman, 141 qu’ieu no me puesc ni voill a vos cobrire.
query.error: **English:** 139 He began to speak freely: 140 "Your courteous request pleases me so much, 141 that I cannot and will not hide from you.
query.result: 139 Ef a-ugh dalleth dhe leverel yn frank, 140 "Kemmys es orth yv an deman kynsa, 141 es na allaf na volaf orth yv dhe gudha."

query.prompt:

query.prompt:

145 Ara vos prec, per aquella valor 146 que vos guida al som de l’escalina, 147 sovenha vos a temps de ma dolor!».

query.result: 145 Wosa hwelow, rag an gallos ma, 146 owth ethol dheg dhe'n uch an escalina, 147 sovenj dhym yn termyn a'm dolor!”.

148 Poi s’ascose nel foco che li affina.
